text: today's recipe is a great tasting really
quick version of a pie it's not exactly
a pie but it's got some great flavors
and a lot of them are very similar to
start off with you want to get your
flavor going with five cloves of minced
garlic one of the things I like to do it
every day food is sort of pear dishes
down to their very bare essentials in a
case like paia some garlic some chorizo
a little bit of wine and seafood often
there's a little bit of saffron in there
but we're skipping that for simplicity
and price first you want to start off by
sauteing your garlic in some oil about
three tablespoons just until it's
fragrant you don't want anything to get
too Brown I was like to first preheat my
pan just a little bit start the cooking
quickly it doesn't matter so much with
garlic because you actually don't want
it to cook too quickly because then
it'll burn but with things like onions
it's always nice to start off with a hot
pan when your garlic turns fragrant add
two ounces of dried chorizo cut into
quarter-inch it pieces and then one and
a half cups of arborio rice arborio is
not a classic Paille rice because it's
not a Spanish rice Italian rice used for
risotto but it's a similar rice to
what's used in pea just by virtue of it
having a short grain if you can get a
Spanish rice like a bomba that would be
great but you don't need to use that
here it's like a pie it's not a Paia
stir your rice to just coat it with the
fat and then add a quarter cup of white
wine and let it evaporate you want the
delicious flavor of the wine but not too
intense so this will cook off some of
the alcohol once your liquid has
evaporated add one and a half cups of
chicken broth
and then a can of diced tomatoes that
have been strained of their liquid you
don't want the liquid just the tomatoes
stir everything together bring it to a
boil reduce it to a simmer and cook
covered for 10 minutes before you add
your finishing ingredients okay it looks
like it's boiling enough for me turn it
down
ten minutes after about ten minutes
uncover it and add 3/4 of pound of
peeled large shrimp distribute it evenly
over the top and a cup of defrosted
frozen peas or you can use fresh peas
but I would cook them a little bit
before I added them cover it back up
again six more minutes or at least until
the shrimp are completely opaque you
should check after like four minutes mmm
YUM
you should stir it once or twice while
it's cooking before and after you add
the shrimp because it'll make it cook
more evenly look at that it's not a
classic pea but it's got a lot of the
same hallmark and it's SuperDuper
delicious make this for dinner tonight
